definition[0]: a tool you use for picking up and eating food, with a handle and three or four points
example[0]: Put the knives and forks on the table.
definition[1]: a garden tool used for digging, with a handle and three or four points
definition[2]: a place where a road, river, or tree divides into two parts, or one of the parts it divides into
example[1]: the north fork of the Sacramento river
example[2]: Take the left fork then go straight on.
definition[3]: one of the two metal bars between which the front wheel of a bicycle or motorcycle is fixed
definition[4]: if a road, river etc forks, it divides into two parts
example[3]: The path forked off in two directions.
definition[5]: to put food into your mouth or onto a plate using a fork
example[4]: He forked some bacon into his mouth.
definition[6]: to put manure into soil or to move soil around using a large garden fork
example[5]: In November, the soil should be forked over.
